Line 44: Line 44:
Google's plans to continue the Nexus brand and bring a third-generation Nexus to market were confirmed by Google's senior vice president of mobile platforms [[Andy Rubin]] in May 2011.<ref>[http://www.techradar.com/news/phone-and-communications/mobile-phones/google-confirms-there-will-be-a-nexus-3-954535 Google confirms there will be a Nexus 3]</ref>
Google's plans to continue the Nexus brand and bring a third-generation Nexus to market were confirmed by Google's senior vice president of mobile platforms [[Andy Rubin]] in May 2011.<ref>[http://www.techradar.com/news/phone-and-communications/mobile-phones/google-confirms-there-will-be-a-nexus-3-954535 Google confirms there will be a Nexus 3]</ref>
The successor to the Nexus S is reported to be the Nexus Prime, also described as the Nexus 3,<ref>[http://www.gizmocrunch.com/mobile/8039-iphone-5-vs-google-nexus-3 Verizon iPhone 5 vs Google Nexus 3: Which Has Better Hardware?]</ref> Nexus 4G,<ref name="yahoo143600226">[http://news.yahoo.com/googles-nexus-prime-android-4-0-ice-cream-143600226.html Google's 'Nexus Prime' with Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich allegedly set for October release]</ref> Samsung GT-I9250 (GSM),<ref name="androidguysgti9250wifi">[http://www.androidguys.com/2011/08/26/samsung-gti9250-aka-nexus-prime-receives-wifi-certification/ Samsung GT-I9250 aka Nexus Prime Receives WiFi Certification]</ref> Samsung Galaxy Nexus,<ref>[http://www.gforgames.com/gadgets/new-google-nexus-prime-specs-release-date-14015/ New Rumored Google Nexus Prime Specs And Details â Release Date: October (Rumored)]</ref> again to be manufactured by Samsung,<ref name="androidauthority21857">[http://www.androidauthority.com/google-nexus-prime-launch-date-october-made-by-samsung-21857/ Google Nexus Prime to Come Out of Samsungâs Phone Mill in October]</ref><ref>[http://gizmodo.com/5820353/sly-tweet-says-samsungs-making-the-nexus-prime-android-40-phone Sly Tweet Says Samsung's Making the Nexus Prime Android 4.0 Phone]</ref> DROID Prime, and Samsung SCH-i515 (CDMA) and to be launched in October 2011<ref name="brighthand18084">[http://www.brighthand.com/default.asp?newsID=18084&news=Google+OS+Android+Nexus+Prime+release+date Google Nexus Prime Set for October Launch]</ref> as a direct competitor to the [[iPhone 4S|fifth generation of the iPhone]].<ref name="telegraph8711809">[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/google/8711809/Google-readies-new-Nexus-smartphone-to-battle-iPhone-5.html Google 'readies new Nexus smartphone' to battle iPhone 5]</ref>
The successor to the Nexus S is reported to be the Nexus Prime, also described as the Nexus 3,<ref>[http://www.gizmocrunch.com/mobile/8039-iphone-5-vs-google-nexus-3 Verizon iPhone 5 vs Google Nexus 3: Which Has Better Hardware?]</ref> Nexus 4G,<ref name="yahoo143600226">[http://news.yahoo.com/googles-nexus-prime-android-4-0-ice-cream-143600226.html Google's 'Nexus Prime' with Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich allegedly set for October release]</ref> Samsung GT-I9250 (GSM),<ref name="androidguysgti9250wifi">[http://www.androidguys.com/2011/08/26/samsung-gti9250-aka-nexus-prime-receives-wifi-certification/ Samsung GT-I9250 aka Nexus Prime Receives WiFi Certification]</ref> Samsung Galaxy Nexus,<ref>[http://www.gforgames.com/gadgets/new-google-nexus-prime-specs-release-date-14015/ New Rumored Google Nexus Prime Specs And Details â Release Date: October (Rumored)]</ref> again to be manufactured by Samsung,<ref name="androidauthority21857">[http://www.androidauthority.com/google-nexus-prime-launch-date-october-made-by-samsung-21857/ Google Nexus Prime to Come Out of Samsungâs Phone Mill in October]</ref><ref>[http://gizmodo.com/5820353/sly-tweet-says-samsungs-making-the-nexus-prime-android-40-phone Sly Tweet Says Samsung's Making the Nexus Prime Android 4.0 Phone]</ref> DROID Prime, and Samsung SCH-i515 (CDMA) and to be launched in October 2011<ref name="brighthand18084">[http://www.brighthand.com/default.asp?newsID=18084&news=Google+OS+Android+Nexus+Prime+release+date Google Nexus Prime Set for October Launch]</ref> as a direct competitor to the [[iPhone 4S|fifth generation of the iPhone]].<ref name="telegraph8711809">[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/google/8711809/Google-readies-new-Nexus-smartphone-to-battle-iPhone-5.html Google 'readies new Nexus smartphone' to battle iPhone 5]</ref>
â
It is likely to be the first device to run [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 4.0 ([[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|Ice Cream Sandwich]]),<ref name="yahoo143600226"/> and is expected to feature 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass<ref name="engadget-20111006">{{cite web|last=Volpe|first=Joseph|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus specs leak, headed to Verizon as an exclusive?|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-specs-leak-headed-to-verizon-as-an-exclusi/|publisher=Engaget|accessdate=6 October 2011}}</ref>, a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref>[http://www.bgr.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-full-specs-revealed-verizon-wireless-exclusive/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+TheBoyGeniusReport+%28BGR+|+Boy+Genius+Report%29 BGR: Samsung Galaxy Nexus full specs revealed;] </ref> with an accompanying dual-core [[PowerVR]] SGX543MP2 graphics chip (same as that used on the [[iPad 2]]), 1024 MB of RAM, a 1750 mAh battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 8 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref name="engadget-20111006"></ref> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
+
It is likely to be the first device to run [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)]],<ref name="yahoo143600226"/> and is expected to feature 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass<ref name="engadget-20111006">{{cite web|last=Volpe|first=Joseph|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus specs leak, headed to Verizon as an exclusive?|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-specs-leak-headed-to-verizon-as-an-exclusi/|publisher=Engaget|accessdate=6 October 2011}}</ref>, a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref>[http://www.bgr.com/2011/10/06/samsung-galaxy-nexus-full-specs-revealed-verizon-wireless-exclusive/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+TheBoyGeniusReport+%28BGR+|+Boy+Genius+Report%29 BGR: Samsung Galaxy Nexus full specs revealed;] </ref> with an accompanying dual-core [[PowerVR]] SGX543MP2 graphics chip (same as that used on the [[iPad 2]]), 1024 MB of RAM, a 1750 mAh battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 8 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref name="engadget-20111006"></ref> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
Samsung mobile put out a teaser video<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=oM9RO-GAKjE YouTube: SAMSUNG Mobile Unpacked 2011 - Google Episode Teaser Video]</ref> for its "Google Episode" of Unpacked on October 11th<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/05/samsung-teases-next-weeks-unpacked-offers-a-momentary-glance/ Samsung teases next week's 'Unpacked,' offers a momentary glance at a mysterious device]</ref> but later postponed the product announcement<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/07/samsung-and-google-postpone-ice-cream-sandwich-and-galaxy-nexus/ Samsung and Google postpone Ice Cream Sandwich and Galaxy Nexus]</ref> out of respect, following the passing of [[Apple Inc.]] co-founder [[Steve Jobs]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Samsung Nexus Prime smartphone delay is 'Jobs tribute'|url=https://encrypted.google.com/url?url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-15236915&rct=j&sa=X&ei=ch6TTo_7I6TXiALi99zmCw&ved=0CDYQ-AsoATAA&q=nexus+prime&usg=AFQjCNExSHgoJsLA54a7k7mVGA7r6xYWjA&cad=rja|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=10 October 2011}}</ref>
Samsung mobile put out a teaser video<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=oM9RO-GAKjE YouTube: SAMSUNG Mobile Unpacked 2011 - Google Episode Teaser Video]</ref> for its "Google Episode" of Unpacked on October 11th<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/05/samsung-teases-next-weeks-unpacked-offers-a-momentary-glance/ Samsung teases next week's 'Unpacked,' offers a momentary glance at a mysterious device]</ref> but later postponed the product announcement<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/07/samsung-and-google-postpone-ice-cream-sandwich-and-galaxy-nexus/ Samsung and Google postpone Ice Cream Sandwich and Galaxy Nexus]</ref> out of respect, following the passing of [[Apple Inc.]] co-founder [[Steve Jobs]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Samsung Nexus Prime smartphone delay is 'Jobs tribute'|url=https://encrypted.google.com/url?url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-15236915&rct=j&sa=X&ei=ch6TTo_7I6TXiALi99zmCw&ved=0CDYQ-AsoATAA&q=nexus+prime&usg=AFQjCNExSHgoJsLA54a7k7mVGA7r6xYWjA&cad=rja|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=10 October 2011}}</ref>
